HDG.LOG.content: [Heidegger’s ear] hearing more than just picking up sounds, if it is [anatomical, biological], goes in one ear out the other [but, apprehension lives (lebt) only when embodied (leibt)] > in that case, we are not gathered to what is addressed (Zugesprochene) [heterotautology of hearing and hearkening (Horchen)] > wrong direction: turn anatomical hearing into a spiritual one

HDG.ID.content: Being and man have already reached each other in their active nature (Wesen), both are mutually appropriated, extended as a gift, one to the other [Being needs man] > leap implies we don’t reside where we already are [leap as conversion, Augustine]

HDG.ID.content: the frame (Ge-stell) as a 2nd forgetting [?], prevents even Being of beings as presence > w/in Ge-stell must experience (erfahren) strange ownership/appropriation in which man & Being are delivered over to each other, must enter into Ereignis (event of appropriation), the word Ereignis [“the words” in English translation] should speak as a key term in service of thinking [via dissemination, Derrida deconstructs “key”] > Ereignis as singulare tantum, happens only in singular, not in any number, uniquely (einzig)

HDG.ID.content: Being as unconcealing overwhelming (enterbergenden überkommnis), beings in sense of arrival (Ankunft): are present, thus differentiated, by virtue of the Same, the differentiation > “the difference of Being & beings, as the differentiation of overwhelming & arrival, is the perdurance (Austrag) of the 2 in the unconcealing keeping in concealment” > being apart & toward each other of overwhelming/arrival: clearing of what veils & closes itself off

HDG.IM.content: word & meaning are bound > “Being itself relies on word in a totally different and more essential sense than any being does” [transcendental signifier, value?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: word & meaning are bound > “Being itself relies on word in a totally different and more essential sense than any being does” [transcendental signifier, value?]

HDG.BC.content: man attends (achtet) either to his needs (braucht) or what he can do w/out; latter not calculation, considers everything from a standpoint limited to essential: only apparent restriction, really a release into expanse of demands that befit man’s essence, attending to dispensable (Entbehrliche) brings man into simplicity, totally other (ganz anderen) domain [no calculation = limited to essential?]

HDG.BC.content: [do we belong anywhere at all?] to merely anticipate (ahnen) where we could belong: necessary to experience ourselves: “ourselves” re: what determines us, is other than us, but governs us [totally other?]: (we call this arbitrarily at first [willkürlich zunächst]) the inception of our history

HDG.BC.content: whole of beings, incomparable, something singular, doesn’t occur twice [what about iterability? other beginning?]

HDG.BC.linkedContent: whole of beings, incomparable, something singular, doesn’t occur twice [what about iterability? other beginning?]

HDG.BC.content: “is” as connecting word must be totally “empty” [khōra] > “to be”: indispensable but fundamentally (im Grunde) empty representation
HDG.BC.linkedContent: “is” as connecting word must be totally “empty” [khōra] > “to be”: indispensable but fundamentally (im Grunde) empty representation

HDG.BC.content: guidewords (Leitworte) > being is emptiest at same time surplus (Überfluss) > “is” indicates emptiness (Leere) (reflection [Nachdenken] can find no support [Anhalt]) & wealth (Reichtum) w/in which Being of beings pronounces (ausspricht) itself > w/ “is,” a surplus put into words [is this different w/ any other word? transcendental signifier]

motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.BC.linkedContent: guidewords (Leitworte) > being is emptiest at same time surplus (Überfluss) > “is” indicates emptiness (Leere) (reflection [Nachdenken] can find no support [Anhalt]) & wealth (Reichtum) w/in which Being of beings pronounces (ausspricht) itself > w/ “is,” a surplus put into words [is this different w/ any other word? transcendental signifier]

HDG.TB.content: [Augustine] beginning of Western thinking, Being is thought, not as “It gives” as such, latter withdraws in favor of gift which it gives > giving which gives only its gift, in giving holds itself back and withdraws, such a giving we call sending [lookup] > Being—that which It gives—is what is sent [other names for Being]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.TB.linkedContent: [Augustine] beginning of Western thinking, Being is thought, not as “It gives” as such, latter withdraws in favor of gift which it gives > giving which gives only its gift, in giving holds itself back and withdraws, such a giving we call sending [lookup] > Being—that which It gives—is what is sent [other names for Being]

HDG.BT.content: [Heidegger lists spirit among other problematic historical domains of Being: ego cogito, subject, reason, person]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.BT.linkedContent: [Heidegger lists spirit among other problematic historical domains of Being: ego cogito, subject, reason, person]

HDG.BT.content: in investigations where thing is deeply veiled, don’t overestimate results: constantly face possibility of disclosing an even more primordial/universal horizon from which to draw answer to question: “What is Being?” [Seinsfrage] > must reawaken question of Being before achieving positive results, arrive at a field where we can come to terms w/ it in a way that can be controlled [totally other—then teleological control?]
HDG.BT.linkedContent: in investigations where thing is deeply veiled, don’t overestimate results: constantly face possibility of disclosing an even more primordial/universal horizon from which to draw answer to question: “What is Being?” [Seinsfrage] > must reawaken question of Being before achieving positive results, arrive at a field where we can come to terms w/ it in a way that can be controlled [totally other—then teleological control?]

HDG.WM.content: humans tend to seek when they’ve anticipated being at hand, is there a search w/out anticipation (Vorwegnahme), to which pure discovery belongs [totally other]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.WM.linkedContent: humans tend to seek when they’ve anticipated being at hand, is there a search w/out anticipation (Vorwegnahme), to which pure discovery belongs [totally other]

HDG.WM.content: no annihilation (Vernichtung) of whole of beings takes place in anxiety > nothing doesn’t attract, essentially repelling (abweisend) > nothing itself nihilates (das Nichts selbst nichtet), grants the nothing, not submitted to calculation of annihilation or negation (Verneinung) > nihilation manifests beings in heretofore concealed strangeness as what is radically other (schlechthin Andere) [totally other] re: nothing > originally nihilating nothing brings Dasein, for 1st time, before beings as such—in anxiety original openness of Being

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"
motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

HDG.WM.linkedContent: no annihilation (Vernichtung) of whole of beings takes place in anxiety > nothing doesn’t attract, essentially repelling (abweisend) > nothing itself nihilates (das Nichts selbst nichtet), grants the nothing, not submitted to calculation of annihilation or negation (Verneinung) > nihilation manifests beings in heretofore concealed strangeness as what is radically other (schlechthin Andere) [totally other] re: nothing > originally nihilating nothing brings Dasein, for 1st time, before beings as such—in anxiety original openness of Being

HDG.IWM.content: thinking that sets out to experience ground of metaphysics, attempt to recall truth of Being > [totally other, beyond Being] from point of view of metaphysics ground appears as ground [cf. 279n Being as nonground (Nichtgrund), X ground], presumably something else experienced in its own terms, something as yet unsaid, something other than metaphysics

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.IWM.linkedContent: thinking that sets out to experience ground of metaphysics, attempt to recall truth of Being > [totally other, beyond Being] from point of view of metaphysics ground appears as ground [cf. 279n Being as nonground (Nichtgrund), X ground], presumably something else experienced in its own terms, something as yet unsaid, something other than metaphysics

HDG.QB.content: thinking needed urgently, granted that [if?] an adequate experience of this essence [essence of nihilism] can be prepared only in a responsive thinking [always preparing adequate experience] > essence of nihilism is heal-less (Heil-lose), unique pointer toward salutary [cf. p. 322 w/ hearty greetings] > if thinking to approach (nähern) realm of essence of nihilism, must necessarily become more precursory (vorlaüfiger) & thereby become other [totally other???]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.QB.linkedContent: thinking needed urgently, granted that [if?] an adequate experience of this essence [essence of nihilism] can be prepared only in a responsive thinking [always preparing adequate experience] > essence of nihilism is heal-less (Heil-lose), unique pointer toward salutary [cf. p. 322 w/ hearty greetings] > if thinking to approach (nähern) realm of essence of nihilism, must necessarily become more precursory (vorlaüfiger) & thereby become other [totally other???]

HDG.QB.content: essence of human being, “Dasein in human being,” is nothing human [the trace, totally other] > when the idea of human essence grounds everything present (i.e. human authoritative, underlying ground): secures beings in their being, (human essence is the presence that first) permits “representation”

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.QB.linkedContent: essence of human being, “Dasein in human being,” is nothing human [the trace, totally other] > when the idea of human essence grounds everything present (i.e. human authoritative, underlying ground): secures beings in their being, (human essence is the presence that first) permits “representation”

HDG.QB.content: [responding to Jünger on whether one doesn’t need certain concepts—only comprehension of an actuality] our concern not only w/ concepts of science but w/ fundamental words like Gestalt, domination (Herrschaft), representation (Repräsentation), power, will, value, security (Sicherheit), presence (Praesenz) (presencing [Anwesen]), nothing > fundamental words (Grundworten) of thinking are an other kind than metaphysical concepts > in latter: that which concepts (Begriffen) grasp (begreifen) same as this very grasping (Begreifen) [strange phrasing on the difference btwn forgetting fundamental words and using them unexamined]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

motif.name: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP
motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.QB.linkedContent: [responding to Jünger on whether one doesn’t need certain concepts—only comprehension of an actuality] our concern not only w/ concepts of science but w/ fundamental words like Gestalt, domination (Herrschaft), representation (Repräsentation), power, will, value, security (Sicherheit), presence (Praesenz) (presencing [Anwesen]), nothing > fundamental words (Grundworten) of thinking are an other kind than metaphysical concepts > in latter: that which concepts (Begriffen) grasp (begreifen) same as this very grasping (Begreifen) [strange phrasing on the difference btwn forgetting fundamental words and using them unexamined]

HDG.QB.content: [immense degree of waiting] perhaps moment will come [not yet] when essence of nihilism will show itself more clearly in other ways, in brighter light, until then setting out on a path that leads to a discussion of essence of Being, on this path alone can question concerning the nothing be discussed (must relinquish language of metaphysics [does that include Being?], but [still?] subject to other demands than changing an old terminology for a new one [paleonym] > endeavor to undertake transformation will presumably remain tentative for a long time [not yet there, telos], that’s not an adequate reason for failing to undertake it

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

HDG.QB.linkedContent: [immense degree of waiting] perhaps moment will come [not yet] when essence of nihilism will show itself more clearly in other ways, in brighter light, until then setting out on a path that leads to a discussion of essence of Being, on this path alone can question concerning the nothing be discussed (must relinquish language of metaphysics [does that include Being?], but [still?] subject to other demands than changing an old terminology for a new one [paleonym] > endeavor to undertake transformation will presumably remain tentative for a long time [not yet there, telos], that’s not an adequate reason for failing to undertake it

HDG.QB.content: say too little of Being when directed to human essence, say too much when we mean all-encompassing and make human one particular entity among others [Being needs human] [usage of Being]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.QB.linkedContent: say too little of Being when directed to human essence, say too much when we mean all-encompassing and make human one particular entity among others [Being needs human] [usage of Being]

HDG.QB.content: by no means easier to say “being” than to speak of the nothing > shows how once more, inevitably, everything depends (ankommt) on correct saying (rechte Sagen), the logos whose essence logic/dialectic of metaphysics can never experience > is it due to “being” (as Same) that our saying fails? all too readily suspected as so-called “mysticism”? > [beyond Being, Derrida] would the crossing of the line leave language of fundamental words to whim of those who are speaking? enough for language to be universally comprehensible? or do other [uniquely unique] laws/measures prevail here [totally other]? (these questions are scarcely beginning to become worthy of question—to feel home in them)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.QB.linkedContent: by no means easier to say “being” than to speak of the nothing > shows how once more, inevitably, everything depends (ankommt) on correct saying (rechte Sagen), the logos whose essence logic/dialectic of metaphysics can never experience > is it due to “being” (as Same) that our saying fails? all too readily suspected as so-called “mysticism”? > [beyond Being, Derrida] would the crossing of the line leave language of fundamental words to whim of those who are speaking? enough for language to be universally comprehensible? or do other [uniquely unique] laws/measures prevail here [totally other]? (these questions are scarcely beginning to become worthy of question—to feel home in them)

HDG.QB.content: what is the Ort of the nothing? > thinking continually led around/chased around the Same as though a magical circle, w/out ever being able to approach this Same [beyond Being] > “good definition” of nihilism points us toward realm that demands a different saying (anderes Sagen) [totally other?] > if turning belongs to “Being,” so that latter resides (beruht) in former, then “Being” dissolves [auflösen] into the turning [logic of exemplarity] > [the first] X Being, initially to prevent “Being” from being a being that then stands face-to-face w/ human (Being not independent from human being) [Being needs human]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.QB.linkedContent: what is the Ort of the nothing? > thinking continually led around/chased around the Same as though a magical circle, w/out ever being able to approach this Same [beyond Being] > “good definition” of nihilism points us toward realm that demands a different saying (anderes Sagen) [totally other?] > if turning belongs to “Being,” so that latter resides (beruht) in former, then “Being” dissolves [auflösen] into the turning [logic of exemplarity] > [the first] X Being, initially to prevent “Being” from being a being that then stands face-to-face w/ human (Being not independent from human being) [Being needs human]

HDG.QB.content: question “What is metaphysics?” at first relies indiscriminately on distinction Being/being, but when it asks of Being’s surpassing of beings, becomes one of those questions that stabs itself in the heart, not so that thinking may thereby die, but live in transformed manner [living suicide] > ponder what is other than beings [Being as totally other?]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.QB.linkedContent: question “What is metaphysics?” at first relies indiscriminately on distinction Being/being, but when it asks of Being’s surpassing of beings, becomes one of those questions that stabs itself in the heart, not so that thinking may thereby die, but live in transformed manner [living suicide] > ponder what is other than beings [Being as totally other?]

HDG.QB.content: sciences believe representation of being exhausts entire realm of what can be researched, apart from beings there’s “nothing else” > metaphysics distinguished by science by the surpassing: Being of beings > for science, Being can only present itself as nothing > how do things stand w/ that which is totally other (ganz Anderen) than anything that is, that which is not a being (i.e. Being)? [Being not crossed out]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.QB.linkedContent: sciences believe representation of being exhausts entire realm of what can be researched, apart from beings there’s “nothing else” > metaphysics distinguished by science by the surpassing: Being of beings > for science, Being can only present itself as nothing > how do things stand w/ that which is totally other (ganz Anderen) than anything that is, that which is not a being (i.e. Being)? [Being not crossed out]

HDG.QB.content: Dasein “held into (hineingehalten)” “this” nothing: humans hold free the site (Ort) for the totally other (ganz Anderen) than beings, so that w/in this openness something like coming to presence (An-Wesen) (Being) can be given > Der Mensch ist der Platzhalter des Nichts

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.QB.linkedContent: Dasein “held into (hineingehalten)” “this” nothing: humans hold free the site (Ort) for the totally other (ganz Anderen) than beings, so that w/in this openness something like coming to presence (An-Wesen) (Being) can be given > Der Mensch ist der Platzhalter des Nichts

HDG.QB.content: nothing is not beings but nevertheless given: Being & nothing employ (verwendet) themselves one for the other in kinship (Verwandtschaft) whose essential fullness [why full?] we’ve scarcely heeded (kaum bedacht) [not yet there] > there is a giving (Es gibt) > Being no more “is” than nothing: Es gibt both [giving then beyond Being?]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.QB.linkedContent: nothing is not beings but nevertheless given: Being & nothing employ (verwendet) themselves one for the other in kinship (Verwandtschaft) whose essential fullness [why full?] we’ve scarcely heeded (kaum bedacht) [not yet there] > there is a giving (Es gibt) > Being no more “is” than nothing: Es gibt both [giving then beyond Being?]

HDG.QB.content: [Heidegger’s method as Destruction then building (for dwelling)?] build path (Weg) leads back to locality (Ortschaft) of recovery (Verwindung) of metaphysics to let us journey through what is destined in overcoming (Überwindung) nihilism [not there yet, narrative yet to come] > despite rejection of text for publication [annihilation of trace], he who learns must examine more originarily, w/ greater care, the saying of reflective thinking, might leave such saying in realm of mystery one day, as highest gift (höchstes Geschenk) & greatest danger [beyond Being, the worst, totally other, risk annihilation?]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.QB.linkedContent: [Heidegger’s method as Destruction then building (for dwelling)?] build path (Weg) leads back to locality (Ortschaft) of recovery (Verwindung) of metaphysics to let us journey through what is destined in overcoming (Überwindung) nihilism [not there yet, narrative yet to come] > despite rejection of text for publication [annihilation of trace], he who learns must examine more originarily, w/ greater care, the saying of reflective thinking, might leave such saying in realm of mystery one day, as highest gift (höchstes Geschenk) & greatest danger [beyond Being, the worst, totally other, risk annihilation?]

HDG.FS.content: diapheromenon (of Heraclitus) unfolding (Entfaltung) of contraries, grounded in inapparent character (Unscheinbaren) of logos > opposites exclude, contraries correspond (“Die Gegensätze schliessen einander aus, während die Widerwendigen sich entsprechen”) > [correspond as letting each other reciprocally come forth]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.FS.linkedContent: diapheromenon (of Heraclitus) unfolding (Entfaltung) of contraries, grounded in inapparent character (Unscheinbaren) of logos > opposites exclude, contraries correspond (“Die Gegensätze schliessen einander aus, während die Widerwendigen sich entsprechen”) > [correspond as letting each other reciprocally come forth]

HDG.FS.content: origin of dichotomy [subject/object]: mutation of truth into certainty, priority given to man as ego cogito, rise to position (Stellung) of subject > nature becomes object (ob-jectum), nothing other than “what is thrown over against me (das mir Entgegengeworfene)”

HDG.FS.content: what is the Same in which day passes to night? the en, the unity, other name for Being? world, light, space, time, etc.—all too general (allgemeinen)

HDG.FS.content: dimension of entirely excessive [totally other?] is that in which philosophy arises (entspringt), philosophy as answer (Antwort) of a humanity struck (betroffenen) by excess of presence, philosophy as a hyper-Greek way of ek-sisting

HDG.FS.content: [some historical reflections on Seinsfrage, includes Being and Time] from question of meaning of Being to truth of being to place or location of Being, thus “topology of Being”: 3 terms that succeed each other & 3 steps along way of thinking: MEANING-TRUTH-PLACE (topos)

HDG.FS.content: technology not grounded in physics, physics grounded in essence of technology > [Kant establishes program of program] physics observes nature as succession [series, sequence] of things, not as course of things emerging (hervorgehenden) from each other [like Aristotle]

HDG.FS.linkedContent: technology not grounded in physics, physics grounded in essence of technology > [Kant establishes program of program] physics observes nature as succession [series, sequence] of things, not as course of things emerging (hervorgehenden) from each other [like Aristotle]

HDG.FS.content: negative (Nichten) vs. denying (Verneinen): Greek distinction ouk and mē? > negating as Greek ouk, then nothing as total nothingness (nihil negativum): beings denied, there are no beings > negating via mē, certain defect re: being > but if being/nothing are same, nothing can’t signify a lack (Fehlen), negating not privative-negative, something other (etwas Anderes), completely specific/unique (ganz und gar Eigenes und Unvergleichliches)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.FS.linkedContent: negative (Nichten) vs. denying (Verneinen): Greek distinction ouk and mē? > negating as Greek ouk, then nothing as total nothingness (nihil negativum): beings denied, there are no beings > negating via mē, certain defect re: being > but if being/nothing are same, nothing can’t signify a lack (Fehlen), negating not privative-negative, something other (etwas Anderes), completely specific/unique (ganz und gar Eigenes und Unvergleichliches)

HDG.FS.content: nothing characterizes being: ontological proposition > when nothing & its negating aren’t understood negatively, being is something entirely other (etwas ganz und gar Anders) than a being > participle “nihilating (nichtend)” as determinate activity of being, durch die allein das Seiende ist > name it an origin if all ontic-causal overtones are excluded [possible?]: Ereignis of Being as condition for arrival (Ankunft) of beings: das Sein lasst das Seinde anwesen [factical life]

motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.FS.content: to leave (verlassen) region (Bereich) of consciousness and attain (erreichen) that of Dasein: to see that “human only exists (ist) in coming from itself to what is wholly other [ganz anderen] than itself, in coming to the clearing of being”

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.FS.linkedContent: to leave (verlassen) region (Bereich) of consciousness and attain (erreichen) that of Dasein: to see that “human only exists (ist) in coming from itself to what is wholly other [ganz anderen] than itself, in coming to the clearing of being”

HDG.CCP.content: non-willing: 1) willingly to renounce willing 2) what remains absolutely outside any kind of will > these 2 stand in definite relation to each other > what moves our conversation claims my attention, challenges me

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.CCP.linkedContent: non-willing: 1) willingly to renounce willing 2) what remains absolutely outside any kind of will > these 2 stand in definite relation to each other > what moves our conversation claims my attention, challenges me

HDG.CCP.content: transcendental horizonal re-presenting, horizon/transcendence go/pass beyond object, but only relative to object > horizon still something else besides horizon (beyond its appearance as horizon of our representing), this something else is other side of itself, so same as itself

HDG.CCP.content: other side of horizon as a region, enchanted region: “where everything belonging there returns in that in which it rests” > openness as a region, the region of regions, the region

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.CCP.linkedContent: other side of horizon as a region, enchanted region: “where everything belonging there returns in that in which it rests” > openness as a region, the region of regions, the region

HDG.DL.content: look for essence of gesture in a beholding that is invisible (unsichtbaren Schauen) [moral image of thought?], bears itself to encounter (entgegenträgt) emptiness (Leere), so that mountains appear > that emptiness same as nothingness, essential being (Wesende) we search to think: the other of all that is present & absent (das Andere zu allem An- und Abwesenden)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: look for essence of gesture in a beholding that is invisible (unsichtbaren Schauen) [moral image of thought?], bears itself to encounter (entgegenträgt) emptiness (Leere), so that mountains appear > that emptiness same as nothingness, essential being (Wesende) we search to think: the other of all that is present & absent (das Andere zu allem An- und Abwesenden)

HDG.DL.content: hints [traces?]: enigmatic (rätselhaft), Sie winken uns zu, Sie winken ab [hints hint toward us, hint away] > “they beckon ourselves toward that from which they unexpectedly (unversehens) [unforeseeably] bear themselves toward us” > hints & gestures not signs, chiffres (latter have there habitat in metaphysics) [cf. p. 27] > hints/gestures belong to totally other (ganz anderen) Wesensraum [realm of reality?]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: hints [traces?]: enigmatic (rätselhaft), Sie winken uns zu, Sie winken ab [hints hint toward us, hint away] > “they beckon ourselves toward that from which they unexpectedly (unversehens) [unforeseeably] bear themselves toward us” > hints & gestures not signs, chiffres (latter have there habitat in metaphysics) [cf. p. 27] > hints/gestures belong to totally other (ganz anderen) Wesensraum [realm of reality?]

HDG.DL.content: language: fundamental trait (Grundzug) im hermeneutischen Bezug des Menschenwesens zur Zwiefalt von Anwesen und Anwesendem [in human nature’s relation to twofold of presence & present beings] > [we must] hear “Bezug” in this statement in a totally other way > not Bezug of demand (Brauchen) & supply (Beibringen) of commodities (Waren), man not a commodity > but man in his essence is in demand (gebraucht), this need claims him (beansprucht) > man is really man when “im Brauch (needed & used by…)” that which calls (ruft) him to preserve (verwahren) twofold

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

motif.name: SOCIAL / COMMODITY / COMMERCE / MARKET see COMMUNITY
motif.title: SOCIAL / COMMODITY / COMMERCE / MARKET see COMMUNITY

HDG.DL.linkedContent: language: fundamental trait (Grundzug) im hermeneutischen Bezug des Menschenwesens zur Zwiefalt von Anwesen und Anwesendem [in human nature’s relation to twofold of presence & present beings] > [we must] hear “Bezug” in this statement in a totally other way > not Bezug of demand (Brauchen) & supply (Beibringen) of commodities (Waren), man not a commodity > but man in his essence is in demand (gebraucht), this need claims him (beansprucht) > man is really man when “im Brauch (needed & used by…)” that which calls (ruft) him to preserve (verwahren) twofold

HDG.DL.content: the call of two-fold can’t be explained by presence or present beings, nor in terms of their relation > only two-fold itself which unfolds (enfaltet) the clarity, the clearing (Lichtung), in which Anwesende als solches and Anwesen can be discerned (unterscheidbar) for man > no longer say relation to two-fold, not an object of mental representation, but: the sway of usage (das Walten des Brauches), which we never experience (erfahren) directly [!] [arrival?] if we think (vorstellen) two-fold as difference (Unterschied) visible in comparison that tries to hold Anwesende and Anwesen apart from each other

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: the call of two-fold can’t be explained by presence or present beings, nor in terms of their relation > only two-fold itself which unfolds (enfaltet) the clarity, the clearing (Lichtung), in which Anwesende als solches and Anwesen can be discerned (unterscheidbar) for man > no longer say relation to two-fold, not an object of mental representation, but: the sway of usage (das Walten des Brauches), which we never experience (erfahren) directly [!] [arrival?] if we think (vorstellen) two-fold as difference (Unterschied) visible in comparison that tries to hold Anwesende and Anwesen apart from each other

HDG.DL.content: [re: “Expression and Meaning (Ausdruck und Bedeutung [double takes on Erscheinung]”] I was concerned to make visible (sichtbar machen) das ganz Andere [the totally other], which [at that time], I had only an obscure (dunkel) or confused intimation (verworren Geahnte) [Derrida beyond Heidegger: can’t make totally other visible]

HDG.DL.content: deeply-concealed kinship (tiefverborgene Verwandschaft) btwn the inquirer and Japaner’s thinking, because the inquirer’s thinking/language is totally other (ganz anders)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: deeply-concealed kinship (tiefverborgene Verwandschaft) btwn the inquirer and Japaner’s thinking, because the inquirer’s thinking/language is totally other (ganz anders)

HDG.DL.content: transformation (Verwandlung) of thinking occurs as a passage (Wanderung), one site left for another, sites placed in discussion (Erörterung), one site (Ort) is metaphysics, the other we leave w/out a name [overcoming metaphysics] > in leaving behind metaphysics, Heidegger leaves behind aesthetics grounded in metaphysics: in such a way that we can give thought to nature of aesthetics, direct it back (verweisen) w/in its boundaries

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: transformation (Verwandlung) of thinking occurs as a passage (Wanderung), one site left for another, sites placed in discussion (Erörterung), one site (Ort) is metaphysics, the other we leave w/out a name [overcoming metaphysics] > in leaving behind metaphysics, Heidegger leaves behind aesthetics grounded in metaphysics: in such a way that we can give thought to nature of aesthetics, direct it back (verweisen) w/in its boundaries

HDG.DL.content: [in metaphysical aesthetics] art work an object for our feelings/ideas, artist the subject related to his work as object: a treacherous framework (verfänglich), can capture (einfangen) all other kinds of experience of art & its nature > Iki is the gracious (Anmutende)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: [in metaphysical aesthetics] art work an object for our feelings/ideas, artist the subject related to his work as object: a treacherous framework (verfänglich), can capture (einfangen) all other kinds of experience of art & its nature > Iki is the gracious (Anmutende)

HDG.DL.content: Koto: the happening holding sway (waltende Ereignen) > language as Koto ba: the petals (Blütenblätter) that stem from Koto > wondrous, names something other than Sprache, glossa, lingua, langue > Heidegger the inquirer prefers Sage, saying, probably means the same as “show (zeigen)”: let appear and let shine—but in the manner of hinting > Japaner has arrived home through beckoning hint of Koto ba

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.DL.linkedContent: Koto: the happening holding sway (waltende Ereignen) > language as Koto ba: the petals (Blütenblätter) that stem from Koto > wondrous, names something other than Sprache, glossa, lingua, langue > Heidegger the inquirer prefers Sage, saying, probably means the same as “show (zeigen)”: let appear and let shine—but in the manner of hinting > Japaner has arrived home through beckoning hint of Koto ba

HDG.LP.content: re: stranger, all who come from the decomposed kind (verwesende Geschlechtes) are others > stranger (Fremdling): “He yonder,” the one who is apart (Ab-geschiedene) > strange thing (Fremdes) called to lose itself, to go under, but that does not mean it’s annihilated (Vernichtung) [or crumbles into shambles]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.LP.linkedContent: re: stranger, all who come from the decomposed kind (verwesende Geschlechtes) are others > stranger (Fremdling): “He yonder,” the one who is apart (Ab-geschiedene) > strange thing (Fremdes) called to lose itself, to go under, but that does not mean it’s annihilated (Vernichtung) [or crumbles into shambles]

HDG.LP.content: night makes the thinker speak other words, can transmute because it too changes > Day’s decline not an end, but makes ready the beginning of Stranger’s wandering > the site of Trakl’s poems: die Abgeschiedenheit (apartness)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.LP.linkedContent: night makes the thinker speak other words, can transmute because it too changes > Day’s decline not an end, but makes ready the beginning of Stranger’s wandering > the site of Trakl’s poems: die Abgeschiedenheit (apartness)

HDG.LP.content: Trakl silently sounds the mystery (Geheimnis) > the unity (Einheit) of “One Generation (Ein Geschlecht),” arises (entquillt) from the race (Schlag) that gathers along path of stranger, enfolds discord of generations into gentler two-fold > One of One Generation, not opposed to two but hidden unifying force [indifference point?] > Geschlecht names historical generation of man, mankind as distinct (Unterschied) from all other living creatures, names race, tribes, clans, families, & always refers to twofoldness of sexes

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.LP.linkedContent: Trakl silently sounds the mystery (Geheimnis) > the unity (Einheit) of “One Generation (Ein Geschlecht),” arises (entquillt) from the race (Schlag) that gathers along path of stranger, enfolds discord of generations into gentler two-fold > One of One Generation, not opposed to two but hidden unifying force [indifference point?] > Geschlecht names historical generation of man, mankind as distinct (Unterschied) from all other living creatures, names race, tribes, clans, families, & always refers to twofoldness of sexes

HDG.WL.content: [re: Ge-stell (Framing)] speaking challenged to correspond totally to Ge-stell, in which all present beings (Anwesenden) can be commandeered, speaking turns to information > informs itself about itself to safeguard its procedures > formalization (calculated availability [rechnerische Bestellbarkeit] of Saying) is goal/norm > even to say that nature of language can’t become part of formalism’s calculations, “natural language” being described negatively

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.linkedContent: [re: Ge-stell (Framing)] speaking challenged to correspond totally to Ge-stell, in which all present beings (Anwesenden) can be commandeered, speaking turns to information > informs itself about itself to safeguard its procedures > formalization (calculated availability [rechnerische Bestellbarkeit] of Saying) is goal/norm > even to say that nature of language can’t become part of formalism’s calculations, “natural language” being described negatively

HDG.WL.content: Humboldt: inner illumination could impart such a different form to language, it would become totally other (ganz anderen) and new [presence worthy of the name?], an old shell (Gehäuse) w/ a new meaning

HDG.TC.content: deliberately speaking of annihilation (Vernichtung), not just destruction (Zerstörung): annihilation is the more encompassing (umfassendere) destruction (also takes into account destruction of countless lives) > can only speak of annihilation by intimations (Andeutungen), point away from what is not meant > annihilation not the highest grade of destruction but essentially other (wesenhaft anderes) than destruction > always something left over w/ destruction, no “remainderless (restlose)” destruction > there is no annihilation at all: the destruction where nothing left remaining, this remainder (Übrig) is nothing: has consumed (aufgezehrt) every “is” & itself > from destruction to annihilation, a change of condition, leap into another essence > not only nothing still left remaining in annihilation, but something, and only, of its own arises (entsteht)

HDG.EC.content: desert is wasteland, deserted abandonment (Verlassenheit) of all life, nothing can emerge from itself [Greek physis] in this wasteland, & in this emergence (Aufgang) call others into a co-emerging (Mitaufgehen) > no perishing (Untergehen) in this desolation

HDG.EC.linkedContent: desert is wasteland, deserted abandonment (Verlassenheit) of all life, nothing can emerge from itself [Greek physis] in this wasteland, & in this emergence (Aufgang) call others into a co-emerging (Mitaufgehen) > no perishing (Untergehen) in this desolation

HDG.EC.content: those among a people (Volk) [Germans?] who poetize/think, wait in most noble manner: durch deren Gegenwart [through the present-waiting of the poet] zum Kommen das Wort in die Antwort des Menschenwesens gelangt und also in die Sprache gebracht wird > poets/thinkers wait on the arrival of this essence of theirs [devastation already passed over?], waiting people endangered like no other [rare], endangered not from outside threats but by tyranny of ignorant impatience, continual mistakes > Während dieses voreilige Scheinwesen [rash pseudo-essence] doch nur die ewig unbeholfene Nachahmung des Fremden bleibt [bad imitation of the foreign, Larry] > the people (Volk) who know its essence, can’t insist on it as a special calling (besondere Berufung)/distinction (Auszeichnung) > waiting people entirely unusable (unbrauchbar) to others, what waits yields nothing to be used (Nutzen) for progress > any fame of these people must squander its essence purely on the unnecessary

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.OHF.content: [phenomenology beyond dialectic] dialectic directionless (richtungslos) when no Grundblick in direction of (auf) the subject matter (Sache), a rationality testing/proving itself by looking this way (i.e. not dialectically) [Heidegger uses rationality affirmatively here?] > all dialectic lives from table of others, Hegel: “this traditional material” (Plato, Aristotle) “extremely importance source, indeed a necessary condition [and] presupposition to be gratefully acknowledged” (Science of Logic) > dialectic is double-sidedly un-radical: 1) lives from hand to mouth 2) eloquent about readymade material

HDG.OHF.content: developing (Ausbilden) of context of classificatory order is the leading self-conditioning mode of philosophy [the other 2: 1) the Ausgangsverhalten 2) accommodating multiplicity of types], analogous to holding-in-view of style in historical consciousness > this leading mode not a mere depicting, but a creative developing (schöpferisches Ausbilden) of the order itself: fashions (bildet) for/out of itself possibility of a universal process

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: developing (Ausbilden) of context of classificatory order is the leading self-conditioning mode of philosophy [the other 2: 1) the Ausgangsverhalten 2) accommodating multiplicity of types], analogous to holding-in-view of style in historical consciousness > this leading mode not a mere depicting, but a creative developing (schöpferisches Ausbilden) of the order itself: fashions (bildet) for/out of itself possibility of a universal process

HDG.OHF.content: relation of definitions of classificatory order: not one and then the other, but one is defined as that which belongs to the other [hetero-tautology], in itself it is the other as well, all others: (Welche Vorhabe? die des Wegsehens!) > the as-well-as (Sowohl-als auch), fundamental formal/categorial structure, limitlessness of its universality [bad infinity?]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: relation of definitions of classificatory order: not one and then the other, but one is defined as that which belongs to the other [hetero-tautology], in itself it is the other as well, all others: (Welche Vorhabe? die des Wegsehens!) > the as-well-as (Sowohl-als auch), fundamental formal/categorial structure, limitlessness of its universality [bad infinity?]

HDG.OHF.content: Besorgenswege [ways of care]: the beings-which-are-there don’t stand w/in definiteness of definitions, but w/in everydayness & its historicity (Geschichtlichkeit); the there in advance (vorhandene Da) brings the appearance (Vorschein) of “others” into its Dasein > what one-self pursues, that wherein one tarries for a while, one-self (man-selbst) “is” this world: everydayness of Dasein has its Dasein there for itself, seeking it by heeding what others say about it: possibilities of familiarity (of everyday) are factically historical [Mitsein]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Besorgenswege [ways of care]: the beings-which-are-there don’t stand w/in definiteness of definitions, but w/in everydayness & its historicity (Geschichtlichkeit); the there in advance (vorhandene Da) brings the appearance (Vorschein) of “others” into its Dasein > what one-self pursues, that wherein one tarries for a while, one-self (man-selbst) “is” this world: everydayness of Dasein has its Dasein there for itself, seeking it by heeding what others say about it: possibilities of familiarity (of everyday) are factically historical [Mitsein]

HDG.OHF.content: significance can only be understood on basis of disclosedness found w/in it, from out of which what is being encountered signifies itself, a pressing forth into its there within other things

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: significance can only be understood on basis of disclosedness found w/in it, from out of which what is being encountered signifies itself, a pressing forth into its there within other things

HDG.OHF.content: [encounter others] appearance of a with-world, not object of knowing, but Vorhandenheit > advance appearance (Vorschein) of factical lives of others: “in a with-world” > others encountered in the “with-”world as others bringing w/ them the “one-self”

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [encounter others] appearance of a with-world, not object of knowing, but Vorhandenheit > advance appearance (Vorschein) of factical lives of others: “in a with-world” > others encountered in the “with-”world as others bringing w/ them the “one-self”

HDG.OHF.content: [Spinoza-like?] all the regions of everyday analysis aren’t to be read over against each other, but as definite modes of world’s being-encountered, each a specific character of the round-about (Um-Charakter)[everything here is condensed]
